page_analysis.text_content:
Daylight plane

The daylight plane in conjunction with the setbacks & height limits, create an invisible tent

intended to contain development on the lot in a way that preserves privacy and exposure to natural light.

Code sections
Page 26
18.12.040 (a) Table 2
Page 27
18.04
Page 28
18.12.040 (c) Table 2
Page 29
18.12.050 (b) (2)
18.12.040 (i)

Primary daylight plane (sides)

The primary daylight plane regulates structures located within the buildable area. Structures located in the rear and/or side yards are regulated by the accessory-structure daylight plan described on the next page.

Fig 20 Front elevation showing side primary daylight plane

Max. allowed is Min. required by Building Code

45°

10' from average grade

Average grade

Grade at the nearest point on the adjacent lot

Existing grade of the structure (at midpoint of wall)

Side lot line

24' max. for protrusions

Max. building height

Side lot line

Notes:

• Daylight plane is measured from average grade.

• Average grade is established using existing grade—before any grading or fill (See Fig 44 p. 42)

• Side daylight plane is measured (up) at lot line.

• Rear daylight plane is measured (up) at rear setback.

visual_elements.description: Front elevation drawing showing a house with dashed lines indicating the side primary daylight plane. The diagram includes vertical measurements such as 10' from average grade, a 45° angle line, and maximum protrusion height of 24'. Labels indicate average grade, grade at nearest point on adjacent lot, existing grade at midpoint of wall, side lot lines, and max building height. The diagram visually represents the invisible tent created by the daylight plane regulating structure height and setbacks.
3D wireframe illustration of an invisible tent representing the daylight plane concept, located in the left sidebar.

technical_specifications.parameter: Height from average grade to start of daylight plane

additional_notes: Left sidebar contains a vertical grey panel with explanatory text and code section references.
Notes section clarifies measurement points for daylight plane and average grade.
No handwritten annotations or stamps present.
cross_references: See Fig 44 p. 42 for details on average grade establishment.
Code sections referenced: 18.12.040 (a) Table 2 (Page 26), 18.04 (Page 27), 18.12.040 (c) Table 2 (Page 28), 18.12.050 (b) (2) and 18.12.040 (i) (Page 29).
Accessory-structure daylight plan described on the next page.

qualifiers.text: The primary daylight plane regulates structures located within the buildable area.
Structures located in the rear and/or side yards are regulated by the accessory-structure daylight plan described on the next page.

conditions.text: Daylight plane is measured from average grade.
Average grade is established using existing grade—before any grading or fill (See Fig 44 p. 42)
conditions.threshold_value: existing grade before grading or fill

conditions.text: Side daylight plane is measured (up) at lot line.
Rear daylight plane is measured (up) at rear setback.

logical_relationships.expression: If daylight plane is measured from average grade, then average grade must be established using existing grade before any grading or fill.

execution_sequence.action: Establish average grade using existing grade before any grading or fill.
Measure daylight plane from the established average grade.
Measure side daylight plane upwards at the lot line.
Measure rear daylight plane upwards at the rear setback.
